intro: Aeschynomene remota, commonly known as the slender sesban, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its leguminous properties and ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, erect stems and small, trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, lens-shaped pods. Aeschynomene remota is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments.
